data.title: William Jennings Bryan
data.text:
William Jennings Bryan (March 19, 1860 – July 26, 1925) was an American lawyer, statesman, and politician.

Sourced quotes

"Success is brought by continued labor and continued watchfulness. We must struggle on, not for one moment hesitate, nor take one backward step."[1]

Simple: You earn success by working hard and being careful. We must move forward.

"I have been so satisfied with the Christian religion that I have spent no time trying to find arguments against it.… I am not afraid now that you will show me any. I feel that I have enough information to live and die by."[2]

Simple: I think that Christianity is perfect.

References

↑ Illinois College Valedictory (1881)

↑ Scopes trial testimony (July 1925)
